description.plain:
Ja Rule, birth name Jeffrey Atkins, is an infamous Hollis, Queens rapper who is signed to Murder Inc.

He dominated the Billboard charts from 1999-2005 as he made hit after hit songs and a string of exceptional and popular albums, beginning with Venni Vetti Vecci in 1999. Other notable Rule albums include Pain is love in 2001 and The Last Temptation in 2002.

Ja rule was often partnered with Ashanti in his songs and helped create hit songs such as “Always On Time”, “Mesmerize” and “Wonderful”.

Ja Rule is also known for his beef with 50 Cent, Eminem and Aftermath Entertainment, which he is thought to have lost and which led to his downfall in the music business.

songs.full_title: Always on Time by Ja Rule (Ft. Ashanti)
songs.title: Always on Time

description.plain: The 1st single released off his 3rd album, ‘Pain Is Love’.  The song became a worldwide hit and was Ashanti’s first Hot 100 number one single and Ja Rule’s second. The song spent 2 weeks at the top of the Billboard Hot 100 from February 23 to March 7, 2002. It was followed by another Ja Rule duet, “Ain’t It Funny” with Jennifer Lopez. In 2009, it was named the 33rd most successful song of the 2000s, on the Billboard Hot R&B/Hip Songs of the Decade Chart.

songs.full_title: Mesmerize by Ja Rule (Ft. Ashanti)
songs.title: Mesmerize

description.plain: Released as the second single from The Last Temptation, Mesmerize is one of Ja Rule’s most-remembered hits and peaked at number 2 on the Billboard Hot 100. Produced by Irv Gotti and sung as a duet with frequent collaborator Ashanti, the song was their fourth top ten hit as a duet. The music video is a homage to the movie musical Grease.

songs.full_title: New York by Ja Rule (Ft. Fat Joe & Jadakiss)
songs.title: New York

description.plain:
Ja Rule connects with Fat Joe and Jadakiss in this ode to “New York” with a chorus that pays homage to KRS-One’s chorus from the 1990 Boogie Down Productions track “100 Guns.” The song was released as the second single from Ja Rule’s sixth album, R.U.L.E., and peaked at #27 on the Billboard Hot 100 and #10 on the Hot Rap Songs chart. Ja, Joe, and Jada—along with producers Cool & Dre—came back together to produce a “New York” sequel for DJ Khaled’s 2007 album We the Best.

Ja’s verse was seen as a diss to 50 Cent, who later dissed Ja, Joe, and Jada on the track “Piggy Bank.”

Fat Joe talked about the original “New York” track in an interview with Complex:


Well, that’s my favorite record I ever did. First of all, it was my record. Ja was trying to come back, and I just told you how he saved my life with ‘What’s Luv’ [after Pun died]. So I gave it to him, and I was like, ‘Yo, my nigga, this is crazy.’ And at the time I think I was just cocky, like I just make hits like it’s a joke. Like, ‘Ahh, here, I’ll make another one tomorrow.’

But it was the fact that it was [all about] New York. I mean, when we shot that video, there was like five or ten thousand people in the streets. The vibe was stupid! To this day, that’s the track I’m most proud of, in my whole rap career.

We kind of gassed Jadakiss to get involved, but I never knew it would get him into a beef with 50 Cent. I never knew ‘New York’ would get me into a beef with 50 Cent. […] And over the years, it turned so much into wrestling, like WWF, that I was like, ‘Alright, I get it.’ But at the time, I had never been disrespected in my life, so I didn’t know how to take it.

songs.full_title: Wonderful by Ja Rule (Ft. Ashanti & R. Kelly)
songs.title: Wonderful

description.plain:
Wonderful is the lead single from rapper Ja Rule’s 2004 album R.U.L.E.. The song features American pop-R&B singers R. Kelly and Ashanti. Famous director Hype Williams directed the music video for the song.

On Ashanti’s album Concrete Rose there was a remix featuring R. Kelly’s chorus and Ja Rule’s two verses from the original, then an added Ashanti verse exclusively for the remix. Which replaced the R. Kelly verse on the original.

songs.full_title: Down Ass Bitch by Ja Rule (Ft. Charli Baltimore)
songs.title: Down Ass Bitch

description.plain:
Ja and Charlie were trying to steal from a rich man’s house, but things went wrong and Charlie got caught, however, he escaped. Even under pressure, Charlie never thought of ratting him out, so that is why he calls her his “down-ass bitch.”

Considered as one of the greatest songs of Ja Rule’s career.

The song appears in “The Wire” in the episode “The Buys.”

songs.full_title: So Much Pain by Ja Rule (Ft. 2Pac)
songs.title: So Much Pain

description.plain:
This song is Ja Rule’s remake of Tupac’s “Pain”.

Ja spoke about this track on an episode of Drink Champs, saying he was recording the song while Pac’s label head Suge Knight was coming home from jail. Ja said:

I had to get the clearance for Pac’s vocals… Suge calls the studio, he’s like ‘Yeah I wanna speak to Rule.’… So he came to the studio and shit, with his goons, and my nigga’s was there. It was like a showdown.

Ja went on to say this is how he and Suge got “cool” with each other. Despite having Suge’s blessing, the use of the Pac sample prompted Eminem, Busta Rhymes and 50 Cent to record the diss track “Hail Mary” aimed at Ja’s use of his vocals.

songs.title: Cry

songs.lyrics:
I Cry Lyrics[Intro - (O'Jay's sample)]
Said we cry, cry, cry, we cry together, oh, oh

[Chorus: Lil' Mo]
When I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together

[Verse 1: Ja Rule]
I love my life, I love my wife, a bad time to prevail
It overwhelmed me, I'm livin' in hell but livin' wealthy
And know these hoes love me because I'm a star
I can't even cop a drink at the bar
Get me some bottles of that Remi Martin, let's get the party
Cracking right here, fuck V.I.P. 
Knowing my baby loves me, home with tears in her eyes
And when I get in, I hurt her more by tellin' her lies
She ain't surprised at me, she just surprised that we
Been together for this long and I can be
The one to mistreat her, thought it'd last forever
'Cause if I cry, you cry, we cry together
[Chorus: Lil' Mo]
When I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together

[Verse 2: Ja Rule]
From what I recall, we was little niggas
Cuttin' school, gettin' high with the hottest bitches
Livin' life so free, that we ain't fearin' the
Ills of the world and the heat of drug dealin'
You and I then made a killin', and stuck together
In this land of forbidden treasure
Love is the only evil seed that could sever a tie this close
Not the love between us, but your love for the dough
You went O.T., started makin' M-O-N-E, why
All my good niggas gotta die?
But shit could last forever, I wish death was pleasure
'Cause when you died, I cried, we cried together

[Chorus: Lil' Mo]
When I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together
You might also like[Bridge: Ja Rule]
Wash away your tears, my love
You ain't gotta cry no more, my love
I put it on everything that I love
That my pain is my love

[Verse 3: Ja Rule]
And I want this world to smile for me
Don't shed a tear, 'cause a nigga died happily
My mama warned me life was a motherfucker
But I ignored the warning and kept on hustlin'
And every night she just looked at me, tears in her eyes
And they be saying shit like, "I don't want me baby to die"
Brought so much pain to her life, gotta make it better
'Cause when ma cried, I cried, we cried together

[Chorus: Lil' Mo]
When I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together
I said I cry, you cry, we cry together

[Outro: Lil' Mo]
Ooh, you cry, then I cry, then we cry
When he cries, I cry, together, together
When I cry, then you cry, then we'll cry together
Yeah-yeah-yeah, yeah-yeah-yeah, yeah-yeah
Yeah, yeah, yeah-yeah, baby
'Cause when Ja cries, Mo cries, we'll cry together
If he cry, then I'll cry, then we'll cry together, yeah
Yeah-yeah, yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah
Mm, oh, yeah-yeah, yeah-yeah-yeah
Oh, woah, oh, woahEmbed

My enemies want sorta the same respect I was born with
"God's Son" tatted on my chest, it's permanent

You cowards, y'all want the crown from the Black power man of Asia
Snap out your dreams and prayers of takin' a king's paper
Ask that other rapper how it feel to lose his whole gangsta (How it feel, man?)

You make me upset, I might stank ya (Blastin')
Inc. is the Murder, Ill Will merger let my cash
Make sex with yo' cash, it can't hurt us

In the ocean like a Amistad slave over boat when
It's a new day, y'all should be scared, I'm back with Stoute
Southside, Queensbridge, the hood's in here

Without you (There's no me, y'all)

Let me talk to these niggas, Gotti (I'm blastin')
Yeah, what up Suge? (It's Murda for life)

[Verse 2: Ja Rule]
And Lord knows I'll die, I pledge allegiance to homicide
And murder be the case when I kill 'em, why
Would they get a nigga like me started?
I'm regarded the hardest workin' artist since 'Pac (Niggas)
And I ain't talkin' if I'm liked or better
I'm talkin', if he was here, we'd probably ride together
On this chick-ass nigga with curls, bitch dog
Get at me, dog, Rule, nigga, the boss
But you always been a pup now, ain't it a pity
That you runnin' to IG, dyin' to be me?
But I pledge, I-N-C and for the love
I'll bleed it in blood and die from hot slugs, motherfuckers
You might also like[Chorus: Ashanti & Nas]
There's no me (Uh, talk to me)
Without you (There's no me y'all)
I can't be (I-N-C)
Without you (Ill Will now)
Don't you know that I will never leave? (Talk to me now)
Leave you (It's no me, y'all)
All I need (I-N-C), need is you

[Bridge: Ashanti]
Murder I-N-C, you know that I can't see myself
Livin' without you, bein' without you, breathin' without you, baby
What you done to me, you know that I can't see myself
Livin' without you, bein' without you, breathin' without you, baby

[Chorus: Ashanti & Nas]
There's no me (There's no me)
Without you (Without you)
I can't be (Can't be)
Without you (Can't be)
Don't you know that I will never leave? (I'll never leave)
Leave you (That I'll never leave)

Without you (There's no me, y'all)

There's no me
[Interlude: 2Pac & Ashanti]
I shall not fear no man but God
Though I walk through the valley of death (Don't you know that I will—)
If I should die before I wake, please, God, walk with me
Grab a nigga and take me to Heaven

[Outro: Ja Rule & Ashanti]
It's Murda
It's Murda for lifeEmbed
